intro: Withania sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe-shaped withania, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its unique, spherical fruit that resembles a small globe. The plant produces small, white flowers and has hairy, glandular leaves that help it retain moisture in dry conditions. Its roots contain alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Withania sphaerocarpa is often found in rocky soils and thrives in environments with low rainfall.
